Package org.cesecore.util

Class ExternalProcessTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.util.ExternalProcessTools
  • public final class ExternalProcessTools
extends Object
    Tools to handle calls with Java Process API

      Writes the byte-array to a temporary file or pipes the PEM certificate into the command, and launches the given external command, see launchExternalCommand(String, byte[], boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, List, String).

      Writes the byte array into a temporary file with the prefix + "-" + System.currentTimeMillies + suffix into the user directory and returns it, or null.

    • Method Detail

      • buildShellCommand

        protected static final List<String> buildShellCommand​(String cmd)
        Builds the platform dependent external command array: - field at index 0 is the interpreter, - field at index 1 is the one and only parameter of the interpreter, - field at index 2 must contain the complete external command, including pipes, chains, sub-shells, etc. and is appended later.
        Parameters:
        cmd - the external command or script
        Returns:
        the command array as list.

      • launchExternalCommand

        public static final List<String> launchExternalCommand​(String cmd,
                                                       byte[] bytes,
                                                       boolean failOnCode,
                                                       boolean failOnOutput,
                                                       List<String> args,
                                                       String filePrefix)
                                                throws ExternalProcessException
        Writes the byte-array to a temporary file or pipes the PEM certificate into the command, and launches the given external command, see launchExternalCommand(String, byte[], boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, List, String).
        Parameters:
        cmd - The command to run.
        bytes - The buffer with content to write to the file.
        failOnCode - Determines if the method should fail on a non-zero exit code.
        failOnOutput - Determines if the method should fail on output to standard error.
        args - Added to the command after the temporary files name
        filePrefix - prefix
        Returns:
        output
        Throws:
        ExternalProcessException - if the temporary file could not be written or the external process fails.

      • launchExternalCommand

        public static final List<String> launchExternalCommand​(String cmd,
                                                       byte[] bytes,
                                                       boolean failOnCode,
                                                       boolean failOnOutput,
                                                       boolean logStdOut,
                                                       boolean logErrOut,
                                                       List<String> arguments,
                                                       String filePrefix)
                                                throws ExternalProcessException
        Writes the byte-array to a temporary file and launches the given external command with the file as argument at index positional parameter index 1 or the pipes the PEM certificate into the command. The function will, depending on its parameters, fail if output to standard error from the command was detected or the command returns with an non-zero exit code.
        Parameters:
        cmd - The command to run. If the parameter place holder PLACE_HOLDER_CERTIFICATE is used, the PEM certificate is piped into the STDIN of the command (i.e. 'openssl x509 -text -noout %cert%').
        bytes - The buffer with content to write to the file.
        failOnCode - Determines if the method should fail on a non-zero exit code.
        failOnOutput - Determines if the method should fail on output to standard error.
        logStdOut - if the scripts STDOUT should be logged as info.
        logErrOut - if the scripts ERROUT should be logged as info.
        arguments - Added to the command after the temporary files name
        filePrefix - prefix
        Returns:
        output
        Throws:
        ExternalProcessException - if the temporary file could not be written or the external process fails.

      • getPlatformString

        public static final String getPlatformString()

      • writeTemporaryFileToDisk

        public static final File writeTemporaryFileToDisk​(byte[] bytes,
                                                  String filePrefix,
                                                  String fileSuffix)
                                           throws ExternalProcessException
        Writes the byte array into a temporary file with the prefix + "-" + System.currentTimeMillies + suffix into the user directory and returns it, or null.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to write.
        filePrefix - the file prefix.
        fileSuffix - the file suffix.
        Returns:
        the file or null.
        Throws:
        ExternalProcessException - any exception.

      • extractExitCode

        public static final Integer extractExitCode​(List<String> out)
        Extracts the exit code in the list (at index 0 prefixed with #EXIT_CODE_PREFIX).
        Parameters:
        out - the output of the external process.
        Returns:
        the exit code.

      • containsErrout

        public static final boolean containsErrout​(List<String> out)
        Checks if the list contains logging to ERROUT.
        Parameters:
        out - the output of the external process.
        Returns:
        true if the list contains logging to ERROUT.
